meta_description: The Greene County Historical Society, preserving the history and heritage of Greene County, New York since 1929.
admission_text:
## **Participate in a Historic Cause**

The Greene County Historical Society has successfully relied on nothing but membership dues and private contributions since we were founded in 1929. These funds allow us to maintain and interpret the [Bronck House and farm](/bronck-houses-barns) and run an adjoining [research facility](http://vedderresearchlibrary.org) in Coxsackie, NY while also awarding scholarships to high schoolers, assisting with original research, and funding publication of books related to the history of Greene County.

[SELECT YOUR MEMBERSHIP LEVEL](/membership-levels)

### to buy a membership or renew: 

  1. Click “select your membership level” on the photo next to these instructions. 

  2. Browse our membership levels, click on each to review different benefits.

  3. When you find the membership level you want, click on it and hit the “Purchase” button. 

  4. Fill out our form, and follow the prompts to submit your secure payment by credit card or PayPal. 

_NOTICE: Anyone purchasing a membership at or above the “Patron” level is automatically enrolled in the North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM) Association - this membership gives you free or discounted access to hundreds of participating museums across the United States.  
_[_Click here to find out more about NARM_](https://narmassociation.org/learn-more/)

* * *
collections_text:
# Preserving the History and Heritage of Greene County, New York since 1929

[ Make a Contribution Today ](/donate)

* * *

Bronck House Museum

The oldest home in Upstate New York and the headquarters of GCHS is open for tours annually from May to October. The museum is currently closed for the season. To schedule a tour for our upcoming season, please click the link below.

[Book a Tour](/schedule-tour)

Vedder Research Library

The archives and special collections of the Greene County Historical Society, open year-round to researchers and the general public.

[Learn More](https://vedderresearchlibrary.org)

Mid-Hudson Cable’s Home Town Spotlight of the Bronck Museum!

* * *
